channel.title: University of California Berkeley Public Events occurring between 11/16/2013 12:47:45 AM - 11/23/2013 12:47:45 AM
channel.description: A listing of public events for University of California Berkeley occurring between 11/16/2013 12:47:45 AM - 11/23/2013 12:47:45 AM

item.author: unaberkeley@gmail.com (United Nations Association of Berkeley)
item.title: Nothing But Nets Fundraiser for Malaria (Basketball Tournament!)
item.description:
Saturday, November 16, 2013 (4:00 PM - 7:00 PM)
Location: Hearst Gym

United Nations Association of Berkeley is hosting a fundraiser for Nothing but Nets: a campaign of the United Nations Association to save lives by sending insecticide-treated bed nets to areas infested with malaria-carrying mosquitoes. More info here: http://www.nothingbutnets.net/

To fundraise for this cause, we will be hosting a 3-on-3 basketball tournament and the winning team receives $75!!
All proceeds will go to Nothing But Nets. 

To sign up, just find us on Sproul and pay $5/player and fill out this form: 
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1fIZuam_ON230-NT-jHsfhRcDAHkonrfL0i2aaTcyCvE/viewform 

Donations are also accepted.

item.author: no-reply@collegiatelink.net (Danceworx)
item.title: DANCEWORX FALL 2013 INDOOR SHOWCASE
item.description:
Saturday, November 16, 2013 (7:30 PM) - Saturday, November 16, 2013 (9:30 PM)
Location: Zellerbach Playhouse

GET IT IN... DOOR!

Danceworx presents its FALL 2013 INDOOR SHOWCASE. Join us on Saturday, November 16th for an amazing show!


What: Danceworx Indoor Showcase
Where: Zellerbach Playhouse
Date: Saturday, Nov 16th
Time: Doors open at 7:00 PM; show starts promptly at 7:30 PM
Cost: $11 pre-sale; $14 at the door

--------------------------------------------------------------
Get ready for another incredible indoor showcase put on by Berkeley's oldest student-run dance group! All 10 Danceworx hip-hop, jazz, and tap pieces will be performing, as well as many mini & guest performance pieces from groups such as: TruElement, AFX, Abba Modern, THRIVE, [M]ovement, & more!

Tickets are $11 pre-sale or $14 at the door and can be purchased from any DWX member or from our table on Upper Sproul the weeks before. 
--------------------------------------------------------------

Get ready everyone, it's going to be awesome!!!!!

You know you love us,
XOXO ♥ DWX

item.author: no-reply@collegiatelink.net (LDS Student Association)
item.title: Church
item.description:
Sunday, November 17, 2013 (10:00 AM - 1:00 PM)
Location: 2368 Leconte Avenue

We have three church meetings every sunday at the Berkeley institute building at 2368 Leconte Avenue and we invite all to come join us!

Our meetings beginning at 10 and the last meeting gets out at 1!

10-11: Sacrament Meeting

11-12: Sunday School Classes

12-1: Relief Society and Elders Quorum

 

Go Bears!!

item.author: no-reply@collegiatelink.net (ASUC Student Union Program Entertainment & Recreation Board)
item.title: SUPERB PRESENTS: Born Ruffians
item.description:
Sunday, November 17, 2013 (4:30 PM - 6:30 PM)
Location: Upper Sproul

ASUC SUPERB is excited to bring Born Ruffians to the UC Berkeley campus for FREE on Sunday November 17 on Upper Sproul.

Toronto's Born Ruffians feature Luke LaLonde (vocals/guitar), Mitch DeRosier (bass/vocals), and Steve Hamelin (drums). Formed in 2002, the indie rock trio creates a jaunty mix of shifty guitar riffs and hyper-chic vocals for a Pixies-esque shredded kind of sweetness. An appearance at the annual Pop Montreal festival and U.S. tour dates with Hot Chip and Shy Child coincided with the release of Born Ruffians' self-titled debut EP for Warp Records in October 2006. The band's first full-length, Red Yellow & Blue, arrived in spring 2008. They returned with 2010's Say It, which the band recorded in two weeks with producer Rusty Santos. In 2013, Born Ruffians delivered their third studio album, Birthmarks, featuring the single "Needle." 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0BlZVFqUoJ4

*****************************************************

SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 17 

UPPER SPROUL

ALL AGES / FREE / 4:30-6:30 PM

BORN RUFFIANS ON RIGHT AT 5PM

OPENER - ART NIKELS AT 4:30PM

ADA ACCESSIBLE 

*****************************************************
SUPERB - Entertaining UC Berkeley since 1964
http://superb.berkeley.edu/
Like our Facebook Page http://facebook.com/asucSUPERB
Find us on Twitter and Instagram: @asucsuperb
*****************************************************

item.author: no-reply@collegiatelink.net (Startup At Berkeley)
item.title: Berkeley Entrepreneurship Week: Founder Stories feat Quinn Slack
item.description:
Monday, November 18, 2013 (7:00 PM) - Monday, November 18, 2013 (9:00 PM)
Location: Andersen Auditorium, Haas School of Business

Entrepreneurship Week kicks off with a keynote by Quinn Slack, founder of Sourcegraph. The presentation will be followed by a panel with founders of Sequoia Capital, Y-Combinator, and A16z backed companies sharing their entrepreneurial journey. Panelists include:

Quinn Slack- Founder of Sourcegraph

Alon Salant – Founder of Good Eggs (Sequoia Capital Series A)

Matt DeBergalis – Founder of Meteor (YC S11', a16z backed)

Adam Ely – Founder of Bluebox (a16z backed)

Josh Buckley – Founder of Minomonsters (YC W11')

Anson Tsui – Founder of SpoonRocket(YC S13')

Darshan Shankar- Founder of Flotype(YC W11'),  Panel Moderator

item.author: lead@berkeley.edu (*LEAD Center*)
item.title: 11/19 Student Organization Signatory Orientation and ASUC Agent Training
item.description:
Tuesday, November 19, 2013 (4:00 PM - 5:30 PM)
Location: 114 Hearst Gym, Senate Lounge

The LEAD Center Registered Student Organization advising team has undergone a lot of major, exciting changes over the summer. If you are a student interested in being an RSO Signatory for a group this orientation is open to all and is a requirement for ASUC Sponsored groups.

This event is divided into two 45 minute segments:

  • The first 45 minutes are devoted to going over the information and resources necessary for Signatories to effectively manage their organizations
  • The second 45 minutes are devoted to Agent Training for ASUC sponsored groups.

Both segments of this training are required to become a group's 2013-14  ASUC Agent. Students who seek information solely about resources available to Signatories and who are preparing for the Signatory quiz may attend the first 45 minutes.

More Information:

To maintain active status, all Registered Student Organizations must have at least 4 acting members registered with the LEAD Center asSignatories. Signatories are the authorized representatives of the organization that voluntarily assume responsibility for the activities and conduct of the organization.  In order to become a signatory, an individual must successfully pass a Signatory quiz about University resources, policies, and procedures that pertain to student groups. 

Groups that have ASUC Sponsorship are required to have student representatives attend annual training to become official ASUC Agents. Agents are responsible for managing a group’s ASUC Sponsorship, spaces, and Funding.. The best students to attend this training are those in President and Treasurer roles (they do not need to attend together) but anyone can attend at the group's discretion. 

Questions? Contact the LEAD Center Peer Leadership Consultants:

LEAD Center
102 Hearst Gym
510-642-5171
lead@berkeley.edu

item.author: ucbsda@gmail.com (Student Dietetic Association)
item.title: Dietetic Conference
item.description:
Tuesday, November 19, 2013 (6:00 PM) - Tuesday, November 19, 2013 (9:00 PM)
Location: 174 Barrows Hall
Are you interested in dietetics? Want to know more about what opportunities are out there for dietitians or nutrition-related professions? Then come to Student Dietetic Association's Dietetic Conference on Tuesday, November 19th from 6-9 pm in 174 Barrows. We will be hosting respected dietitians from around the Bay Area who will be discussing their education paths, careers, what it means to be a registered dietitian, and any other questions you may have. Light refreshments will be provided and the cost is $2 for members and $3 for nonmembers. If you have any questions, please feel free to email ucbsda@gmail.com. Thank you and looking forward to seeing you there!
 
Jessica Soldavini, MPH, RD is a registered dietitian and UC Berkeley Nutrition Science – Dietetics alumni. While attending UC Berkeley, she was an active member of SDA, and served numerous officer positions, including president. After graduating from UC Berkeley, she completed the VA Greater Los Angeles Dietetic Internship Combined Program and received her MPH from UCLA. Currently, she works for the Santa Clara County Public Health Department, where she works under two grants – one aimed at helping low-income individuals make healthy food choices and be physically active, and the other focused on breastfeeding promotion. Working on these grants allows her to be involved with a variety of different projects, including teaching nutrition education classes to low-income community members; providing nutrition education at community events; training other providers to teach nutrition and physical activity through train-the-trainer sessions; and working on policy, systems and environmental changes. 
 
 

Evelyn Little MS RD
Evelyn received her B.S. in Clinical Dietetics and Nutrition from the University of Pittsburgh in 2011.  She continued onto the Coordinated Masters in Dietetics program, where she earned her M.S. and completed her supervised practice hours at UPMC Presbyterian Hospital.  She recently moved to San Francisco, where she started a job as a Per Diem Clinical Dietitian at California Pacific Medical Center.

 

Joanne Ikeda is a nationally recognized expert on pediatric obesity and the dietary practices of ethnic and immigrant population. Ikeda has been a pioneer in conducting community collaborative research on the food habits and dietary quality of California's low-income, immigrant and ethnic populations. Her findings are used to develop culturally sensitive and relevant educational programs for these groups, which have included Hmong families in the Central Valley; Vietnamese-American communities in Northern and Southern California; Native Americans in rural areas; and African American women in urban areas of the state.

 
 
Alisha Rowe attended the University of North Florida for undergrad, then continued   with their combined dietetic internship program, and graduated in 2011 with her MS in Nutrition, and completed her 1200 internship. After graduation, she moved out to San Francisco, and worked full-time at the Veteran's Affairs Hospital as an outpatient dietitian. Alisha also has experience with eating disorders and nutrition & wellness. Currently Alisha is the operations manager for a fresh smoothie start-up in San Francisco. She believes that there is so much opportunities for Dietitians beyond the traditional hospital, food service, and community sectors. She hopes to create and provide a new platform for dietitians in health & wellness field. 
 
 
Shauna Pirotin, MPH, RDN 
I attended UC Berkeley as an undergraduate in Dietetics and pursued a coordinated program at the University of Washington in Seattle where I completed my Dietetic Internship and Masters in Public Health. This program interested me since I always had an interest in community nutrition. In my current position, I work as a manager at the Native American Health Center WIC located in the Fruitvale District in Oakland, where I help with administrative tasks and overlook and perform nutritional counseling for low income Women, Infants and Children. Between my internship and my current position, I did evaluation work for San Francisco Unified School District’s Child Nutrition Services program, childhood obesity prevention research for UC Berkeley’s Center for Weight and Health, and worked briefly as a nutrition consultant for Marin’s Head Start Program.

item.author: no-reply@collegiatelink.net (Startup At Berkeley)
item.title: Berkeley Entrepreneurship Week: Leadership feat CTO of Evernote
item.description:
Tuesday, November 19, 2013 (7:00 PM) - Tuesday, November 19, 2013 (9:00 PM)
Location: Banatao Auditorium, Sutardja Dai Hall

Q&A panel with the leaders of both big and small companies. They will discuss how new technology is changing the way we interact with each other and how this new technology changed how we run businesses. Understand the decision making process of top executives from the Bay Area. Panelists include:

Dave Engberg – CTO of Evernote

Brandon Golm – Senior Director of Engineering at Eventbrite

Jeff Burton – Executive Director of SkyDeck & Founder of EA

David McIntosh- Founder & CEO of Redux

Mark Lindsey- VP of Engineering at Homejoy

item.author: berkeley@studentspill.com (Supporting Peers in Laid-Back Listening)
item.title: SPILL LIVE
item.description:
Tuesday, November 19, 2013 (7:00 PM) - Tuesday, November 19, 2013 (9:00 PM)
Location: 251 Dwinelle

Need to just vent about school, family, or the latest episode of How I Met Your Mother? 

Check out SPILL LIVE: bringing all the perks of the website to you in person. 

SPILL LIVE is an open forum where students can come talk about their problems freely and get feedback and advice from their fellow peers.

item.author: no-reply@collegiatelink.net (American Indian Graduate Student Association)
item.title: Crossing Paths: Graduate & Undergraduate Exchanges of Indigenous Research
item.description:
Wednesday, November 20, 2013 (12:00 PM - 1:00 PM)
Location: 554 Barrows Hall, UC Berkeley

 

This 1st annual student lecture series aims to provide a space for graduate and undergraduate students to showcase their research. Bringing graduate and undergraduate students together is a critical step toward shortening the divide between the two, while also facilitating conversations about Native peoples and issues across campus. 

Each lecture will feature a Native faculty or staff member as a moderator, two presenters (one grad student and one undergrad), and a complimentary lunch. 

We hope to see you there!

item.author: info@forum.berkeley.edu (Berkeley Forum, The)
item.title: Panel: Predator or Protector? - The Ethics and Effectiveness of Drones
item.description:
Wednesday, November 20, 2013 (6:00 PM - 7:30 PM)
Location: B100 Blum Center

Join UC Berkeley students, staff and faculty at Blum Hall for an informative discussion about the increasingly controversial topic of unmanned aerial vehicles. Speakers include:

• Morris Davis, Former Chief Prosecutor, Guantanamo Military Commissions
• Avery Plaw, Professor of Political Science, UMass Dartmouth
• Bradley Strawser, Assistant Professor, Naval Postgraduate School

✶ ✶ ✶ OPEN TO THE PUBLIC ✶ ✶ ✶

EVENT DETAILS …………………………………………………………………………
Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2013 
Time: 6:00 p.m. Attendance is first-come, first-served.
Venue: B100 Blum

EVENT DESCRIPTION ……………………………………………………………………
Three distinguished panelists with different perspectives and areas of expertise will explain the merits and drawbacks of employing drones in US foreign and domestic policy. The panel will be moderated by students from The Berkeley Forum and will feature former Chief Prosecutor at Guantanamo Bay Morris Davis, Professor of Political Science at the University of Massachusetts Avery Plaw, and Professor of Philosophy at the US Naval Postgraduate School Bradley Strawser. We hope you will join us in this stimulating discussion as the country confronts a growing concern with the moral justifications of unmanned drones.

item.author: rmalhi1@berkeley.edu (Cal AMSA)
item.title: Caliphate: The Question of Islamic Leadership
item.description:
Thursday, November 21, 2013 (6:30 PM - 8:30 PM)

item.author: no-reply@collegiatelink.net (Startup At Berkeley)
item.title: Berkeley Entrepreneurship Week: Venture Capital & Fundraising
item.description:
Thursday, November 21, 2013 (7:00 PM) - Thursday, November 21, 2013 (9:00 PM)
Location: 10 Evans Hall

Panel with venture capitalists from leading firms. They will discussing how they value companies, what they look for in founding teams, and best practices when pitching. Hear the story from a founder's perspective on how to raise. Find out how some of the most important forces in the valley think!

Joe Addiego – Partner at Alsop-Louie

Michael Berolzheimer- Partner at Bee Partners

Andrew Tweed- Associate at Thomvest Ventures

Aaron Schwartz- Founder at Modify Watches

item.author: lead@berkeley.edu (*LEAD Center*)
